data.title: ‘Love at First Sight’ on Netflix: Here is the full soundtrack of the new rom-com movie
data.meta_description: "Love at First Sight" tells the tale of two 20-somethings, Hadley and Oliver, who experience the magic of love during a transatlantic flight from New York to London.
data.text:
Synopsis

"Love at First Sight" tells the tale of two 20-somethings, Hadley and Oliver, who experience the magic of love during a transatlantic flight from New York to London.

Netflix's latest romantic comedy, "Love at First Sight," is captivating audiences with its heartwarming storyline and a soundtrack that strikes all the right chords. As viewers swoon over the delightful on-screen chemistry between the protagonists Hadley Sullivan (Haley Lu Richardson) and Oliver Jones (Ben Hardy), they're also grooving to a playlist that perfectly complements the film's romantic ambiance.

What is ‘Love At First Sight’ about?

"Love at First Sight" tells the tale of two 20-somethings, Hadley and Oliver, who experience the magic of love during a transatlantic flight from New York to London. Filled with endearing inside jokes, a dinner date, and a "first date" movie night on the plane, their connection sparks the imagination of hopeless romantics everywhere. However, the couple's enchanting encounter hits turbulence when they become separated at Heathrow Airport, leaving them on a quest to rediscover their serendipitous connection.

Narrated by the talented Jameela Jamil, the film's soundtrack elevates the storytelling experience to another level. It seamlessly weaves through the plot, enhancing the emotions of love, longing, and serendipity that define Hadley and Oliver's journey.

Love At First Sight Soundtrack:

The "Love at First Sight" soundtrack is a treasure trove of musical gems, featuring an array of catchy tunes and captivating covers. Here's a peek at some of the standout tracks that have viewers buzzing:

"Everything Goes My Way" by Tessa Rose Jackson

"Want to Make You Proud" by Katie Herzig

"I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me)" by Morgan Harper-Jones

"Why Don't We Start From Here" by Lucy Spraggan

"Honey Honey" by Sobi

"Passing Ships" by Morgan Harper-Jones

"Meldo" by Tom Taylor

"Vacation" by Simen Mitlid

"Sunset Lover" by Petit Biscuit

"Lonely" by Morgan Harper-Jones

"Above the Clouds of Pompeii" by Bear's Den

"Bad Kids" by Ttrruuces

"Sleepyhead" by Ttrruuces

"Strange Game" by Jess Ribeiro

"Lemonade" by Circa Waves

"Time" by Angelo De Augustine

"I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me)" by Calper Jones

"When Love Arrives" by Andreya Triana

FAQs:

What is a soundtrack?

A soundtrack refers to the collection of music or audio recordings, typically songs and instrumental compositions, that are used in conjunction with visual media such as movies, television shows, video games, or theatrical productions. The purpose of a soundtrack is to enhance the viewer or listener's experience by providing an auditory accompaniment that complements and reinforces the emotions, themes, and mood of the visual content.

Who is Morgan Harper-Jones?

Morgan Harper-Jones is a British singer-songwriter and musician known for her work in the music industry.
